snippet: Ambassador Samantha Power asserted that Syria might not have handed over all its chemical arms supplies for destruction, and that they could fall into the hands of militants.
abstract: Samantha Powers, United States ambassador to the United Nations and president of the Security Council, expresses concern that Syria's government may be harboring undeclared chemical weapons, and that Islamist militant extremists ISIS ensconced in the country could possibly seize control of them.
lead_paragraph: Ambassador Samantha Power asserted that Syria might not have handed over all its chemical arms supplies for destruction, and that they could fall into the hands of militants.

headline.main: Syria May Have Hidden Chemical Arms, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Syria May Have Hidden Chemical Arms, U.S. Says
